====Compounds====
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|承諾|しょうだく}}: consent, acquiescence
* {{ja-r|承知|しょうち}}: consent, acceptance
* {{ja-r|承認|しょうにん}}: recognition, acknowledgment
* {{ja-r|承服|しょうふく}}: compliance, consent
* {{ja-r|承継|しょうけい}}: succession, accession
* {{ja-r|継承|けいしょう}}: inheritance, succession
* {{ja-r|伝承|でんしょう}}: transmission, hand down
* {{ja-r|了承|りょうしょう}}: acknowledgment
{{der-bottom}}

====Usage notes====
This may be the only kanji with a six-{{l|en|mora}} reading, of ''uketamawari''.  However, this reading is more often spelled with the final ''-ri'' spelled in kana (as {{m|ja|承り}}) to clarify and disambiguate the reading of the single kanji.

This kanji is also one of very few kanji with five-{{l|en|mora}} readings, and the only verb, namely {{m|ja|承る|tr=uketamawaru|pos=with the kanji comprising the five-mora ''uketamawa-'' part}}. Other kanji with five-mora readings are the nouns {{m|ja|志|tr=kokorozashi}}, {{m|ja|詔}} / {{m|ja|勅|tr=mikotonori}}, and {{m|ja|宰}} / {{m|ja|司|tr=mikotomochi}}. No kanji have a reading of more than six morae.
